title: Value of an implicit derivaitive at a given  point

content.question: Suppose <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>ln</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>ln</mi><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4073@</annotation> </semantics> </math> , where y is a differentiable function of x and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyEaiabg2da9iaaisdaaaa@38B6@</annotation> </semantics> </math> when <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2da9iaaisdaaaa@38B5@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. What is the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A2F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> when <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2da9iaaisdaaaa@38B5@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
